<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_register_generic_device:
```c
int metal_register_generic_device(struct metal_device *device)
{
	if (!device->name || !strlen(device->name) ||
	    device->num_regions > METAL_MAX_DEVICE_REGIONS)
		return -EINVAL;

	device->bus = &metal_generic_bus;
	metal_list_add_tail(&_metal.common.generic_device_list,
			    &device->node);
	return 0;
}
```

explanation: The rest of the code contains no other function calls that could produce direct or indirect recursion. Specifically: the checks of device->name and device->num_regions are simple pointer/field accesses and comparisons; METAL_MAX_DEVICE_REGIONS and EINVAL are compile-time macros/constants; the assignment device->bus = &metal_generic_bus; and the return statements do not invoke functions. Therefore only the two function-call expressions listed above need investigation for possible indirect recursion.
